doc.name: wsedit
doc.synopsis: Defines an input field for pages to be edited
doc.description: How to edit pages in the wiki with WSForm
doc.parameters:
target = targetpage

template = name of template to be used

formfield = Name of the field in the template. Field in the form should have the same name

usefield = If the field in the form differs from the formfieldname, you can use "usefield" to let wsedit know what other field from the form it should use

value= don't read the value from the form field, but use this value explicitly

As off version 0.8.0.9.7.7 WSForm supports the WSSlot extension. If you have that extension installed WSForm can write content to different content slots in MediaWiki. This functionality is called Multi-Content Revisions. To tell wsedit to edit to a different slot use mwslot :

mwslot = name of slot to use
doc.note:
• You can have multiple wsedit's in a form all doing different tasks.
  • If you have more than 5 edits to one singe page in the wiki, consider wscreate to speed-up the process.
  • If you omit value, then the value of the form will be used (so what a user has filled in).
